headline: SK&Co.
pros: Stable job. Good for learning Governmental and Public School Auditing. Down to Earth upper management.
cons: Salary is based in the early 1990’s. They don’t like to pay people. Or invest in anything for that matter. When I worked there, they were still using green 14 column paper and red rope folders. But that’s how they keep large clients. Current billing for the Managing Partner is still only $150 an hour. I was billed at $225 when I was a Staff II at a larger firm.

headline: Staff Accountant
pros: Small Firm. Exposure to most tasks in governmental auditing. Once you learn how to do everything, is pretty easy. Family-like atmosphere. Benefits are decent. Okay place to get exposure to public accounting.
cons: Extremely Limited Growth. Basically no organizational structure. Pay is on the low end in comparison to other Public Accounting Firms in the area. Limited use of accounting software. No reimbursement whatsoever for passing CPA exam. No 401K match. Work can be tedious and monotonous.
